member.name: IOleDocumentView.ApplyViewState
member.summary: Initializes a view with view state previously saved in call to .
member.param: A pointer to a stream containing data from which the view should initialize itself.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The value in pstm is NULL.
This view has no meaningful state to load. This error should be rare because most views will have at least some state information worth loading.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.Clone
member.summary: Creates a duplicate view object with an internal state identical to that of the current view.
member.param: A pointer to a interface that represents the view site in which the new view object will be activated. On receiving this pointer, the view being cloned should pass it to the new view's method. This pointer can be NULL, in which case the caller is responsible for calling IOleDocumentView.SetInPlaceSite on the new view directly.
A pointer to an pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the new view object. The caller is responsible for releasing ppViewNew when it is no longer needed.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The value in ppViewNew is NULL.
The view object does not implement this interface.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.CloseView
member.summary: Instructs a document view to close itself and release its pointer.
member.param: This parameter is reserved and cannot be NULL.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.GetDocument
member.summary: Obtains the interface pointer on the document object that owns this view.
member.param: A pointer to an interface pointer that receives a pointer to the document object that owns this view.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK on success. S_OK is the only valid return value for this method.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.GetInPlaceSite
member.summary: Retrieves the view site associated with this view object.
member.param: A pointer to an pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the document's view site.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible values include:

member.name: IOleDocumentView.GetRect
member.summary: Retrieves the rectangular coordinates of the viewport in which the view is or will be activated.
member.param: A pointer to a structure to contain the coordinates of the current viewport set with .

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: This view has not yet seen a call to or and therefore has no rectangle to return.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.Open
member.summary: Displays a document view in a separate pop-up window. The semantics are equivalent to with OLEIVERB_OPEN.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: Insufficient memory available for the operation.
The document object that owns this view does not support separate window activation.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.SaveViewState
member.summary: Saves the view state into the specified stream.
member.param: A pointer to the stream in which the view is to save its state data.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The value in pstm is NULL.
This view has no meaningful state to save. This error should be rare because most views have at least some state information worth saving.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.SetInPlaceSite
member.summary: Associates a container's document view site with a document's view object.
member.param: A pointer to the document view site's interface. This parameter can be NULL, in which case the document view object loses all asociation with the container.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK if a document view site was successfully associated (or disassociated if pIPSite is NULL) with a document view object. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.SetRect
member.summary: Sets the rectangular coordinates of the viewport in which the view is to be activated or resets the coordinates of the viewport in which a view is currently activated.
member.param: A pointer to a structure containing the coordinates of the viewport.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.SetRectComplex
member.summary: Sets the rectangular coordinates of the viewport, scroll bars, and size box.
member.param: A pointer to a structure containing the coordinates of the viewport.
A pointer to a structure containing the coordinates of the horizontal scroll bar.
A pointer to a structure containing the coordinates of the vertical scroll bar.
A pointer to a structure containing the coordinates of the size box.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The document object that owns this view does not support complex rectangles.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.Show
member.param: If TRUE, the view is to show itself. If FALSE, the view is to hide itself.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleDocumentView.UIActivate
member.summary: Activates or deactivates a document view's user interface elements, such as menus, toolbars, and accelerators.
member.param: If TRUE, the view is to activate its user interface. If FALSE, the view is to deactivate its user interface.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

summary.para: The IOleDocumentView interface enables a container to communicate with each view supported by a document object.

A document object that supports multiple views of its data represents each view as a separate object. Each document view object implements IOleDocumentView, along with , , and optional interfaces such as and . A document object that supports only a single view does not require that view to be implemented as a separate object. Instead, both document and view can be implemented as a single class.
